1.text: My son, do not forget my law, but let your heart guard my precepts.

2.text: For they shall set before you length of days, and years of life, and peace.

3.text: Let not mercy and truth abandon you: encircle them around your throat, and inscribe them on the tablets of your heart.

4.text: And so shall you discover grace and good discipline, in the sight of God and men.

5.text: Have confidence in the Lord with all your heart, and do not depend upon your own prudence.

6.text: In all your ways, consider him, and he himself will direct your steps.

7.text: Do not seem wise to yourself. Fear God, and withdraw from evil.

8.text: Certainly, it shall be health to your navel, and refreshment to your bones.

9.text: Honor the Lord with your substance, and give to him from the first of all your fruits,

10.text: and then your storehouses will be filled with abundance, and your presses shall overflow with wine.

11.text: My son, do not discard the discipline of the Lord, and do not fall away when you are corrected by him.

12.text: For whomever the Lord loves, he corrects, and just as a father does with a son, he wins him over.

13.text: Blessed is the man who finds wisdom and who advances to prudence.

14.text: Her acquisition is better than trading in silver, and her fruit is better than the first and purest gold.

15.text: She is more precious than all riches, and all that can be desired cannot prevail in comparison to her.

16.text: Length of days is at her right hand, and at her left hand is wealth and glory.

17.text: Her ways are beautiful ways, and all her paths are peaceful.

18.text: She is a tree of life to those who overtake her, and he who shall take hold of her is blessed.

19.text: The Lord founded the earth on wisdom. He secured the heavens with prudence.

20.text: By his wisdom, the abyss erupted and the clouds increased with dew.

21.text: My son, let not these things move away from your eyes. Preserve law as well as counsel.

22.text: And so shall there be life in your soul and grace in your voice.

23.text: Then you shall walk confidently in your way, and your feet will not stumble.

24.text: When you slumber, you shall not fear. When you rest, your sleep also will be sweet.

25.text: Do not fear unexpected terror, nor the power of the impious falling upon you.

26.text: For the Lord will be at your side, and he will guard your feet, so that you may not be seized.

27.text: Do not prevent him who is able from doing good. When you are able, do good yourself too.

28.text: Do not say to your friend: “Go away, and then return. Tomorrow I will give to you.” When you are able to do so, give in the present.

29.text: Do not undertake evil against your friend, even though he has trust in you.

30.text: Do not contend against a man without cause, even though he has done no evil to you.

31.text: Do not rival an unjust man, and do not imitate his ways.

32.text: For everyone who ridicules is an abomination to the Lord, and his communication is for the simple.

33.text: Destitution in the house of the impious is from the Lord. But the habitations of the just shall be blessed.

34.text: He will ridicule those who ridicule, but he will bestow grace upon the mild.

35.text: The wise will possess glory. The exaltation of the foolish is disgraceful.
